programme.title: Three's A Crowd
programme.desc: To get Vicky to accept his standing marriage proposal, Jack attempts to reunite Vicky's divorced parents. First appearance of Mrs. Bradford.

programme.title: Three's A Crowd
programme.desc: Jack's old friend, Larry invites him to a swinging party where an old flame makes a move on Jack.

programme.title: Three's A Crowd
programme.desc: Jack convinces Vicky to invest in a case of vintage wine, but when it turns out to be sour, he takes a job at a sushi house to repay her.

programme.title: Three's A Crowd
programme.desc: After Jack and James get drunk together, James is arrested for urinating in public and ends up in court.

programme.title: Three's A Crowd
programme.desc: Jack seeks advice from a psychologist about his recent impotence. Vicky thinks Jack is cheating on her with E.Z.'s girlfriend Susie.

programme.title: Three's A Crowd
programme.desc: Jack lies to his visiting Aunt Mae to try to cover up his living arrangement with Vicky. Jack hires surfer E.Z. Taylor as his assistant at the restaurant.

programme.title: Three's A Crowd
programme.desc: Vicky's former boyfriend opens a seafood restaurant across from Jack's Bistro and makes Jack jealous.

programme.title: Three's A Crowd
programme.desc: With his restaurant suddenly popular after a glowing review, Jack forgets about his and Vicky's first anniversary.

programme.title: Check It Out
programme.desc: The staff start gossip about Marlene and Christian who apparently went home together after an office party.

programme.title: Check It Out
programme.desc: Bannister is in competition with another store manager for the Vice-President position at Cobb's.

programme.title: Check It Out
programme.desc: When slow construction starts bringing Cobb's business down, Bannister has to decide two employees to lay off.

programme.title: Check It Out
programme.desc: Feeling neglected by Howard, Edna hires an actor to play her 'secret lover'

programme.title: Check It Out
programme.sub-title: Buddy Can You Spare a Job?
programme.desc: Bannister decided to hire his old friend as the store's new butcher. Before long, the new hire is offending everyone in sight, and Bannister has to decide to fire him or not.

programme.title: Too Close For Comfort
programme.desc: When the tenant in the downstairs apartment dies, Sara and Jackie try to persuade their father to let them move in.

programme.title: Too Close For Comfort
programme.desc: Henry and Muriel's discover of "the pill" in Sara's drawer leads to paternal prowling when Jackie's boyfriend spends the night.

programme.title: Too Close For Comfort
programme.desc: Henry is beside himself when an armored car strike forces Jackie to bring home $100,000 from the bank and Muriel coincidentally hires two ex-cons to do house repairs.

programme.title: Too Close For Comfort
programme.desc: Henry and Muriel's anniversary plans are upset when Sara and her new-found friend Monroe are picked up by police.

programme.title: Too Close For Comfort
programme.desc: A marital squabble send Muriel downstairs with the girls and Monroe upstairs with Henry.

programme.title: Too Close For Comfort
programme.desc: The girls move out of the apartment when Henry refuses to buy the furniture from the late tenant's sister, Mildred Rafkin.

programme.title: Check It Out
programme.desc: Howard stretches the rules a little to allow a young woman to set up her sesame fruit-bar stand in the store. The other staff members soon become distracted by her beauty and Edna gets jealous.

programme.title: Too Close For Comfort
programme.desc: Henry discourages Jackie's new romance with a policeman because of the danger of his profession.

programme.title: Too Close For Comfort
programme.desc: The Rushes have to break the news of Rafkin's death to a bum who spent every Thanksgiving with him, but they can't bear to tell him that Rafkin was not a woman.

programme.title: Too Close For Comfort
programme.desc: Henry is suspected of poisoning his estranged brother during what is supposed to be a reconciliation visit.

programme.title: Too Close For Comfort
programme.desc: A "Cosmic Cow" fanatic steals the puppet from the apartment so Henry and Monroe plan a stakeout to apprehend him.

programme.title: Too Close For Comfort
programme.desc: April's decision to move in with a rich, older man she has been dating creates an uproar at home.

programme.title: Too Close For Comfort
programme.desc: An old friend of Henry's who has a fondness for playing practical jokes comes to visit and claims he has only a short time to live.

programme.title: Too Close For Comfort
programme.desc: On a ski vacation, Sara and Jackie pick up two handsome brothers and leave Henry deserted until he meets the boys' glamorous mother.

programme.title: Too Close For Comfort
programme.desc: In her seventh month, Muriel is feeling unattractive and the beautiful young artist studying with Henry does not help her condition.

programme.title: Too Close For Comfort
programme.desc: Sara and April's booming homemade cookie business crumbles when they are fined for disregarding city business regulations.

programme.title: Check It Out
programme.desc: Faced with a hernia operation, Bannister goes to hospital, only to hear doom stories from his old roommate.

programme.title: Check It Out
programme.desc: When Bannister's heartbroken niece arrives for a visit, Howard goes into an over-protective frenzy.

programme.title: Check It Out
programme.desc: Bannister fills in for Murray's dad on a father and son wilderness survival test.

programme.title: Check It Out
programme.sub-title: A Chocolate Chip Off the Old Block
programme.desc: When Bannister loses the Grandpa Morgan Chocolate Chip Cookie account, help comes from a local bag lady who loves to bake.

programme.title: Check It Out
programme.desc: Christian is seduced by an attractive friend of Edna's. In order to impress her, Jack represents himself as the manager of Cobb's.

programme.desc: Susan drags a reluctant Ben along to a Keep Your Marriage Fresh weekend, where his anarchy and their mutual antipathy get them thrown out by the hippie in charge.

programme.title: The Ropers
programme.sub-title: And Who's Been Sleeping in My... ?
programme.desc: A young woman without a place to live has been sleeping in the Ropers' storage room. Stanley thinks the girl is a dangerous "dope fiend" while Helen wants to let her stay.

programme.title: The Ropers
programme.desc: Helen's mother comes for a visit. But later it is revealed that she has no place to go. So Helen and her two sisters get together to decide what to do, cause none of them really want her living with them.

programme.title: Three's Company
programme.desc: Jack plays cupid to his girlfriend's widowed father, but his arrows misfire when the love-starved older man makes Janet his target.

programme.title: Three's Company
programme.desc: The roommates play a game of musical beds after Janet tells her visiting parents that she and Jack are newlyweds.

programme.title: Three's Company
programme.desc: When a wealthy man becomes obsessed with making a reluctant Cindy his bride, Jack and Janet hatch a strange plot to stop the ceremony.

programme.title: Three's Company
programme.desc: Three's Company, but four's a weird crowd when Ralph Furley loses his job and moves in with Jack, Janet and Cindy.

programme.title: Three's Company
programme.desc: Larry's sly suggestion that he and Jack trade apartments after Jack has a tiff with the girls gives lustful Larry the chance to really put the move on Janet and Cindy.

programme.title: The Ropers
programme.desc: On the day that Helen is making dinner to impress her rich sister, Ethel, the utilities are cut off because Stanley forgot to pay the bills. He goes to great lengths to hide his mistake.

programme.title: The Ropers
programme.desc: Both Stanley and Jeffrey argue with their wives and walk out on them at the same time. Getting drunk at a bar brings them together as buddies, but sobering up may open their eyes to a big problem they've unwittingly created.
